meanings.definition: The act of accumulating or gathering together.
meanings.sent1: The cumulations of leaves in the yard needed to be raked.
meanings.sent2: The cumulations of toys in the playroom made it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent3: The cumulations of socks in the laundry basket seemed to have a party.
meanings.sent4: The cumulations of knowledge in his mind formed a mountain of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The cumulations of coins in the piggy bank jingled with promise.

meanings.definition: An amount of something that has accumulated or been gathered together.
meanings.sent1: She was amazed by the cumulations of books on his shelves.
meanings.sent2: The cumulations of snow on the roof caused it to collapse.
meanings.sent3: The cumulations of candy in the jar tempted her sweet tooth.
meanings.sent4: The cumulations of stars in the night sky sparkled like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The cumulations of dust on the old furniture revealed its age.
